Book.author: Gambardella, Matthew
Book.Title: XML Developer's Guide
Book.Description: An in-depth look at creating applications with XML.

Book.author: Ralls, Kim
Book.Title: Midnight Rain
Book.Description: A former architect battles corporate zombies, an evil sorceress, and her own childhood to become queen of the world.

Book.author: Corets, Eva
Book.Title: Maeve Ascendant
Book.Description: After the collapse of a nanotechnology society in England, the young survivors lay the foundation for a new society.

Book.author: Corets, Eva
Book.Title: Oberon's Legacy
Book.Description: In post-apocalypse England, the mysterious agent known only as Oberon helps to create a new life for the inhabitants of London. Sequel to Maeve Ascendant.

Book.author: Corets, Eva
Book.Title: The Sundered Grail
Book.Description: The two daughters of Maeve, half-sisters, battle one another for control of England. Sequel to Oberon's Legacy.

Book.author: Randall, Cynthia
Book.Title: Lover Birds
Book.Description: When Carla meets Paul at an ornithology conference, tempers fly as feathers get ruffled.

Book.author: Thurman, Paula
Book.Title: Splish Splash
Book.Description: A deep sea diver finds true love twenty thousand leagues beneath the sea.

Book.author: Knorr, Stefan
Book.Title: Creepy Crawlies
Book.Description: An anthology of horror stories about roaches, centipedes, scorpions and other insects.

Book.author: Kress, Peter
Book.Title: Paradox Lost
Book.Description: After an inadvertant trip through a Heisenberg Uncertainty Device, James Salway discovers the problems of being quantum.

Book.author: O'Brien, Tim
Book.Title: Microsoft .NET: The Programming Bible
Book.Description: Microsoft's .NET initiative is explored in detail in this deep programmer's reference.

Book.author: O'Brien, Tim
Book.Title: MSXML3: A Comprehensive Guide
Book.Description: The Microsoft MSXML3 parser is covered in detail, with attention to XML DOM interfaces, XSLT processing, SAX and more.

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: Visual Studio 7: A Comprehensive Guide
Book.Description: Microsoft Visual Studio 7 is explored in depth, looking at how Visual Basic, Visual C++, C#, and ASP+ are integrated into a comprehensive development environment.

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: King Lear
Book.Description: based on the mythological Leir of Britain. King Lear, in preparation for his old age, divides his power and land between two of his daughters. He becomes destitute and insane and a proscribed crux of political machinations.

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: Faust
Book.Description: Mephistopheles (Satan) makes a bet with God: he says that he can lure God's favourite human being (Faust), who is striving to learn everything that can be known, away from righteous pursuits.

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: Nostromo: A Tale of the Seaboard
Book.Description: Charles Gould is tired of the political instability in Costaguana and its concomitant corruption, and uses his wealth to support Ribiera's government, which he believes will finally bring stability to the country after years of misrule and tyranny by self-serving dictators.

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: Crime and Punishment
Book.Description: Rodion Raskolnikov, an impoverished ex-student in Saint Petersburg who plans to kill an unscrupulous pawnbroker, an old woman who stores money and valuable objects in her flat

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: The Red and the Black
Book.Description: He comes from a poor family[1] and fails to understand much about the ways of the world he sets out to conquer

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: The Canterbury Tales
Book.Description: The Canterbury Tales is a collection of stories built around a frame tale, a common and already long established genre in this period.

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: The Decameron
Book.Description: Tales of wit, practical jokes, and life lessons contribute to the mosaic.

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: Book of Job
Book.Description: Job as a righteous man, blessed with wealth, sons, and daughters, who lives in the land of Uz. The scene then shifts to Heaven, where God asks Satan for his opinion of Job's piety

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: Mahabharata
Book.Description: Mahābhārata is the longest epic poem known and has been described as "the longest poem ever written"

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: Zeno's Conscience
Book.Description: The novel is presented as a diary written by Zeno, published by his doctor (who claims that it is full of lies). The doctor has left a little note in the beginning, saying he had Zeno write an autobiography to help him in his psychoanalysis

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: The Idiot
Book.Description: The novel has an awkward structure, and many critics have commented on its seemingly chaotic organization

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: The Death of Ivan Ilyich
Book.Description: Ivan Ilyich lives a carefree life that is "most simple and most ordinary and therefore most terrible". Like everyone he knows, he spends his life climbing the social ladder.

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
Book.Description: ne Hundred Years of Solitude is the story of seven generations of the Buendía Family in the town of Macondo. The founding patriarch of Macondo, José Arcadio Buendía, and Úrsula Iguarán, his wife (and first cousin)

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: Njál's Saga
Book.Description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: Excepteur sint
Book.Description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: War and Peace
Book.Description: The novel is set 60 years before Tolstoy's day, but he had spoken with people who lived through the 1812 French invasion of Russia.

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: Reverend Insanity
Book.Description: An old story about a time traveler who was constantly being reborn. An eccentric world that grows, cultivates, and uses Gu.

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: Lord of Mysteries
Book.Description: The Tarot Club is a Newly Founded Secret Organization of Beyonders created by Klein Moretti

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: I Shall Seal the Heavens
Book.Description: What I want, the Heavens shall not lack!” “What I don't want, had better not exist under the Heavens!”

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: The Trial
Book.Description: On the morning of his thirtieth birthday, Josef K., the chief cashier of a bank, is unexpectedly arrested by two unidentified agents from an unspecified agency for an unspecified crime

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: Odyssey
Book.Description: Odysseus (also known by the Latin variant Ulysses), king of Ithaca, has still not returned because he angered Poseidon, the god of the sea.

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: Medea
Book.Description: Medea is centered on Medea's calculated desire for revenge against her unfaithful husband

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: A Will Eternal
Book.Description: ai Xiaochun, an endearing but exasperating young man who is driven primarily by his fear of death and desire to live forever, but who deeply values friendship and family.

Book.author: Galos, Mike
Book.Title: Pride and Prejudice
Book.Description: Mrs. Bennet's greatest desire is to marry off her five daughters in order to secure their futures. The arrival of Mr. Bingley, a rich bachelor who rents the neighbouring Netherfield estate, gives her hope that one of her daughters might contract an advantageous marriage
